intro: Quinquina carabayensis, commonly known as the Peruvian bittersweet, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and compound leaves. The plant produces small, white to yellowish flowers that are often clustered in inflorescences. Its fruits are follicles that contain seeds, and the plant is adapted to thrive in high-altitude environments. Quinquina carabayensis is also noted for its medicinal properties, particularly in traditional herbal medicine.
